desc: The Speed Bump boulder is a little hard to find, requiring a scramble into a hidden nook. Landing slopes towards a small ledge. Down climb is a walk off the back.

climbs.name: Speed Bump Traverse
climbs.desc: Start as far left as you can. A fun and balancey traverse over bumps towards the twin cracks. Can be reversed as well. ~30 feet long.

climbs.name: Slow Down
climbs.desc: Start on large flakes on the left side the boulder. Continue up on chossy jugs to an easy mantle.

climbs.name: Speed Humps
climbs.desc: Start standing on the black bump near the middle of the boulder. Follow gritty dishes up the boulder.

climbs.name: Speed Bumps
climbs.desc: Start standing to the right of Speed Humps. Follow shallow dishes up the boulder. Finger Crack is off

climbs.name: Speed Fingers
climbs.desc: Strenuous layback or thin fingers up a gritty crack.

climbs.name: Speed Hands
climbs.desc: Deep hands up a juggy crack.

desc: A large, red boulder directly on the ridgeline. It is a great spot to practice footwork, with good holds and sloping feet. Downclimb is a walk off the back

climbs.name: 20 Pound Line
climbs.desc: Start's at same undercling as Jonah's Traverse. Top out directly upon red slopers. Short problem.

climbs.name: Jonah's Traverse
climbs.desc: Start at the right facing undercling with pocketed feet. Traverse right following the horizontal crack and topout right of the "fin"

climbs.name: Up The Gills
climbs.desc: Start at the same undercling as Jonah's Traverse. Move right and up the juggy right leaning crack.

climbs.name: Fintastic
climbs.desc: Start at the right facing undercling with big pockets for feet. Move right towards the horizontal crack and shoot up the "fin". Similar to Jonah's Traverse.

climbs.name: Tall Tails
climbs.desc: Start on the right arete. Follow sandy slopers up to an easy mantle.

desc: A huge Bishop-esque granite egg. Downclimb off the back.

climbs.name: Crimson Tide
climbs.desc: Start with a sharktooth undercling and right facing shelf. Power up into a tricky mantle and a heady slab. Be careful, crimp flake on the left is flexing.

climbs.name: Uncut Gems
climbs.desc: A climb on top of the right fallen flake. Starts on a milky quartz crimp rail. Pull up on incut edges.

desc: A large boulder with varying rock quality. Sits next to Ferb. Downclimb is off the NW side. Watch out for the bird's nest.

climbs.name: Perry
climbs.desc: Start on a large under cling. Move to the left up the large flake and onto small crimps.

climbs.name: The Platypus
climbs.desc: Sit start on a jug shelf on the far left side of the boulder. Traverse right and finish on the same crimps as Perry.

climbs.name: Platypus Direct
climbs.desc: Sit start on a jug shelf on the far left side of the boulder. Traverse right, but before hitting the large flake, pull up to solid crimps.

climbs.name: Phineas Slab
climbs.desc: Start at the same undercling as Perry. Instead of going up the flake to the left, follow small crimps up the slab. Follow the thin diagonal crack to the right to topout.

desc: An even larger boulder with an airy slab on top. Sits next to Phineas. Downclimb off the back.

climbs.name: Ferb Project
climbs.desc: A climb that follows the proud arete closest to Phineas. Start low on parallel cracks and shoot up surprisingly good rock.

climbs.name: Love Handel
climbs.desc: Follow an assortment of huecos and pockets up and right. Grainy.

desc: A boulder with huge oddly shaped pockets. Easy downclimb off the back.

climbs.name: Stanley Yelnats
climbs.desc: The obvious line of pockets trending up and left.

climbs.name: Sploosh
climbs.desc: Deadpoint from the highest pocket above the starting hold to the lip.
